events.title: Executive Order 13771: Reducing Regulation and Controlling Regulatory Costs
events.summary: Order established a 'two-for-one' rule for federal regulations, later rescinded in 2021.

events.title: Executive Order 13992: Revocation of Certain Executive Orders Concerning Federal Regulation
events.summary: Rescinded EO 13771 and related orders, reversing the two-for-one regulatory policy.

events.title: X expands permitted political advertising in the U.S.
events.summary: X (Twitter) announced it would expand permitted political advertising in the United States, loosening a ban in place since 2019.

events.title: X prioritizes verified accounts for recommendations and polls
events.summary: Elon Musk stated that only verified (paid) accounts would be eligible for 'For You' recommendations and for voting in polls, tying organic reach to paid verification.

events.title: YouTube stops removing false claims about past U.S. elections
events.summary: YouTube announced it would no longer remove content alleging fraud in past U.S. elections, shifting to context labels and recommendation interventions.

events.title: X reverses 2019 ban, allows U.S. political ads; verified accounts prioritized in recommendations
events.summary: X (formerly Twitter) reinstated U.S. political ads and emphasized recommendation priority for paid‑verified accounts—shifting political reach toward pay‑to‑play.

events.title: Meta makes political content non-recommended by default on Instagram and Threads
events.summary: Meta said political content from accounts users do not follow would be non-recommended by default on Instagram and Threads, with an opt-in setting to see such content.

events.title: SCOTUS allows Texas SB 4 to take effect temporarily
events.summary: The Supreme Court allowed Texas's SB 4 immigration law to take effect pending further proceedings, before subsequent Fifth Circuit action.

events.title: Fifth Circuit re-blocks Texas SB 4 pending appeal
events.summary: The Fifth Circuit blocked Texas SB 4 after SCOTUS allowed it to take effect temporarily, reflecting rapid back-and-forth on emergency posture.

events.title: Georgia lawmakers make it easier to challenge voter registrations (SB 189)
events.summary: Reporting details how Georgia’s SB 189 facilitates mass challenges to voter eligibility, raising risks of erroneous removals and administrative burden.

events.title: EPA releases PFAS guidance under CERCLA
events.summary: EPA issued guidance on applying CERCLA to PFAS contamination, shaping cleanup responsibilities and enforcement discretion.

events.title: SCOTUS dismisses FDA mifepristone case on standing
events.summary: The Supreme Court held the plaintiffs lacked Article III standing to challenge the FDA’s approval and actions related to mifepristone.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS: No standing in challenge to mifepristone changes (FDA v. AHM)
events.summary: The Supreme Court unanimously held the plaintiffs lacked Article III standing to challenge FDA's 2016/2021 actions on mifepristone, leaving the agency's changes in place.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: Meta political-content filter bug prevents some users from changing setting
events.summary: A bug made it appear that some users could not disable Meta's political-content filter on Instagram/Threads; Meta acknowledged and fixed the issue.

events.title: SCOTUS dismisses social-media coercion case on standing
events.summary: The Supreme Court found that the plaintiffs lacked standing to challenge alleged federal coercion of social-media platforms in moderating content.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: Bug causes Meta political-content filter to remain on for some users
events.summary: Some Instagram/Threads users reported they could not disable the political-content limit setting; Meta acknowledged an 'error' and pushed a fix.

events.title: SCOTUS: Plaintiffs lack standing in social-media coercion case (Murthy v. Missouri)
events.summary: The Supreme Court ruled 6–3 that neither state nor individual plaintiffs established standing to enjoin federal officials over alleged coercion of social-media platforms.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS stays EPA's Good Neighbor Plan
events.summary: On its emergency docket, the Supreme Court stayed EPA’s Good Neighbor Plan for ozone pollution pending further proceedings.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS requires jury trials for certain SEC civil penalties
events.summary: The Supreme Court ruled that when the SEC seeks civil penalties for securities fraud, defendants are entitled to a jury trial rather than adjudication solely before an administrative law judge.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS limits SEC use of in-house tribunals for civil penalties (SEC v. Jarkesy)
events.summary: In a 6–3 decision, the Court held the Seventh Amendment requires jury trials when the SEC seeks civil penalties for securities fraud, curbing use of ALJ proceedings.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS stays EPA 'Good Neighbor Plan' for cross-state smog program
events.summary: The Supreme Court granted a stay blocking the EPA's Good Neighbor Plan addressing interstate ozone pollution while litigation proceeds.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS overturns Chevron deference
events.summary: The Supreme Court overruled Chevron deference in Loper Bright, granting courts more latitude in interpreting ambiguous statutes instead of deferring to agencies.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: SCOTUS overrules Chevron deference (Loper Bright v. Raimondo)
events.summary: A 6–3 majority held courts must exercise independent judgment on statutory meaning, overruling Chevron deference while preserving prior case holdings.
actors: Supreme Court of the United States

events.title: Brennan Center warns Georgia SB 189 spurs mass voter challenges
events.summary: Analysis describes how SB 189 eases third-party challenges to voter eligibility, risking bogus mass filings and administrative overload.

events.title: Fifth Circuit rules geofence warrants unconstitutional general warrants
events.summary: In a key privacy ruling, the Fifth Circuit held Google geofence warrants unconstitutional as general warrants, foreshadowing jurisdictional splits on location dragnet searches.

sources.title: ACLU: Fifth Circuit geofence ruling
Reuters: US appeals court finds geofence warrants unconstitutional

events.title: Fifth Circuit rules broad geofence warrants unconstitutional
events.summary: The Fifth Circuit held that broad geofence warrants are unconstitutional general warrants, though evidence in the case was admitted under the good-faith exception.

events.title: Fifth Circuit holds geofence warrants unconstitutional (U.S. v. Smith)
events.summary: In United States v. Smith, the Fifth Circuit ruled that geofence warrants are modern-day general warrants violating the Fourth Amendment; evidence was admitted under good-faith.
actors: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

events.title: FEC votes to begin rulemaking on AI-generated content in political ads
events.summary: Federal Election Commission opened a rulemaking to consider disclosure requirements for AI in political advertising.

events.title: Pew Research: News on social media in 2024
events.summary: Pew documents the share of U.S. adults who regularly get news via social media platforms and the platform mix.

events.title: Guidance to Georgia officials on mass voter challenges
events.summary: Coalition letter outlines legal concerns and best practices to prevent erroneous mass voter eligibility challenges under SB 189.

events.title: Cochise County supervisor pleads guilty over 2022 certification refusal
events.summary: Arizona’s Cochise County Supervisor Peggy Judd pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor for refusing to certify the 2022 midterm election on time, receiving probation.

events.title: Meta ends third-party fact-checking for U.S. political content
events.summary: Meta announced 'More Speech and Fewer Mistakes,' ending third-party fact-checking for U.S. political content in favor of a community-notes-style system.

events.title: Launch of $TRUMP memecoin; fees and conflicts draw scrutiny
events.summary: Days before inauguration, the Trump family launched the $TRUMP token; subsequent reporting estimated tens of millions to $100M+ in trading fees and concentrated insider ownership.

sources.title: Reuters: Trump’s new meme coin soars on first day in office
Reuters: $TRUMP fees near $100M

events.title: Melania Trump launches $MELANIA token; early traders reap windfalls
events.summary: Following $TRUMP, a Melania‑branded token launched and surged; reporting highlighted pre‑launch holdings by anonymous wallets and rapid cash‑outs by insiders.

sources.title: Al Jazeera: $MELANIA launch and surge
Fortune: Anonymous traders nab ~$100M pre‑launch windfall

events.title: Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) created; Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy tapped to lead
events.summary: A same-day EO created the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to consolidate procurement and IT oversight. Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy were named to senior leadership roles.

sources.title: Executive Order — Establishing the Department of Government Efficiency
Trump creates DOGE; taps Musk, Ramaswamy
White House forms ‘government efficiency’ dept; Musk role draws scrutiny

events.title: Executive Order 14171 reinstates 'Schedule F' in excepted service
events.summary: On Inauguration Day, President Trump signed EO 14171 directing OPM to re-create Schedule F, reclassifying policy-influencing federal positions and easing removals, reviving a 2020 proposal that had been rescinded in 2021.

sources.title: EO 14171 — Reinstating Schedule F
OPM guidance memo implementing EO (Schedule F revival)
What Trump’s Schedule F order would do

events.title: Executive Order establishes the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)
events.summary: President issues an executive order creating DOGE to 'modernize Federal technology and software' and coordinate cost-cutting across agencies.

events.title: Executive Order reinstates “Schedule Policy/Career” (revived Schedule F)
events.summary: President issues an EO reviving and amending Schedule F as “Schedule Policy/Career,” directing agencies to reclassify policy-influencing civil service roles.

sources.title: White House – Restoring Accountability to Policy-Influencing Positions
OPM Guidance memo (implementation)
CRS Legal Sidebar – Policy/Career schedule context

events.title: DHS rescinds 'protected areas' memorandum
events.summary: DHS rescinded prior guidance limiting immigration enforcement in 'protected areas', signaling broader operational latitude.

events.title: Multiple inspectors general removed without 30-day notice
events.summary: The administration removed at least 17 inspectors general without the 30‑day, case‑specific notice to Congress required by statute, drawing bipartisan criticism and litigation.

events.title: At least 17 Inspectors General dismissed without 30-day notice
events.summary: Late-night emails removed at least 17 PAS Inspectors General. Lawmakers cited the 30‑day statutory notice requirement under the Inspector General Act; subsequent litigation followed.

sources.title: Trump administration abruptly fires at least 17 inspectors general
IG Community raises legal concerns over mass firings
Grassley letter on IG removals and 30-day notice

events.title: At least 17 Inspectors General fired in late-night purge
events.summary: Multiple IGs across cabinet agencies were dismissed by email without the 30-day congressional notice required by the 2022 IG law; bipartisan backlash followed.

sources.title: Reuters – Late-night firings criticized as illegal
Politico – IGs say removals may be invalid for lack of notice

events.title: Interior IG Mark Greenblatt reacts to firing: 'stunned'
events.summary: Days after being removed in the late‑January inspector general firings, Interior IG Mark Greenblatt told CBS News he was 'stunned' and questioned the President’s motives.
events.notes: If CBS changes URL, reference CBS News video segment aired late Jan 2025.

events.title: Executive Order 14171: Restoring Accountability to Policy-Influencing Positions
events.summary: Reinstates a version of 'Schedule F' reclassification to ease removal of policy-influencing civil servants; agencies told to identify positions.

events.title: White House says Musk will police his own conflicts in DOGE role
events.summary: Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt says Musk will 'excuse himself' from conflicts related to DOGE—a self-policing arrangement that drew criticism from ethics experts.

events.title: Donor appointments and high-profile nominations (Stephens, Kushner, Isaacman)
events.summary: White House announces nominees including Warren Stephens (UK), Charles Kushner (France), and Jared Isaacman (NASA Administrator; later withdrew).

sources.title: Reuters – Stephens nomination coverage
State Dept – Announcement page (if archived)
NASA Watch – Isaacman nomination and withdrawal

events.title: President fires Special Counsel Hampton Dellinger; litigation ensues
events.summary: The White House emailed Special Counsel Hampton Dellinger that he was terminated from his five‑year term leading the Office of Special Counsel; Dellinger sued, arguing removal violated for‑cause protections.

events.title: Judge denies unions' bid for immediate TRO blocking DOGE data access
events.summary: District Judge John Bates denies a temporary restraining order for labor groups challenging DOGE’s access to personal data; standing concerns noted.

events.title: Courts restrict DOGE access to Treasury/OPM systems; multistate suit proceeds
events.summary: A coalition of state AGs sues to block DOGE access to sensitive federal systems; courts issue/extend preliminary restrictions while cases proceed under Privacy Act and APA.

sources.title: Reuters – Judge extends block on DOGE access to Treasury systems (Feb 21)
EFF – Preliminary injunction re OPM Privacy Act suit (doc set)

events.title: BEAD guidance tweak expands eligibility for LEO satellites (Starlink)
events.summary: Commerce/NTIA adjustments expanded scenarios in which LEO satellite service could qualify for BEAD funding, drawing criticism from fiber advocates.

sources.title: Ars Technica – Changes could steer tens of billions to Starlink
The Verge – Eligibility change draws backlash

events.title: OGE Director removed; office reverts to acting leadership
events.summary: The Office of Government Ethics announced the President removed Director David Huitema, reverting OGE leadership to an acting role.

events.title: Executive Order pauses Foreign Corrupt Practices Act enforcement for 180 days
events.summary: White House issued an order pausing FCPA enforcement pending new DOJ guidance.

events.title: Associated Press barred from White House events; later restored by court
events.summary: The White House blocked AP reporters from pooled access on Feb. 11. On Apr. 8, a federal district court ordered access restored, finding viewpoint discrimination.

events.title: Judge Chutkan questions DOGE authority and lack of structure
events.summary: At a hearing on suits seeking to block DOGE actions, Judge Tanya Chutkan says DOGE appears to be moving in 'no predictable and orderly fashion'; TRO not immediately granted.

events.title: Reports indicate CFPB supervision scaled back; litigation and oversight letters follow
events.summary: Media and advocacy groups report acting leadership curtailed supervision/rulemaking; unions and members of Congress sought documents and filed related claims.

sources.title: American Prospect – How the CFPB Was Shut Down
EPI – Vought orders workers to stop doing their jobs (analysis)

events.title: Kash Patel becomes Director of the FBI
events.summary: President Trump appointed Kash Patel as FBI Director, succeeding Christopher Wray. Patel emphasized a pivot toward violent crime and border enforcement priorities.

sources.title: Kash Patel — Director, Federal Bureau of Investigation
Durbin questions FBI reassignment away from domestic terrorism

events.title: Supreme Court declines to let firing of OSC chief take immediate effect
events.summary: The Supreme Court temporarily kept Hampton Dellinger in place as Special Counsel pending further litigation over the president’s removal authority.

events.title: Reuters: 62,530 federal layoffs in first two months of 2025
events.summary: Challenger data show government accounted for most layoffs early in 2025; actions tied by many outlets to DOGE-driven downsizing.

events.title: Judge Cooper: DOGE likely subject to FOIA; orders record preservation & expedited processing
events.summary: Federal court finds DOGE has 'unusual secrecy' and 'substantial authority,' rejecting claim of full EOP exemption from FOIA.

events.title: Investigations estimate Musk-linked companies have received ~$38B in public support since 2003
events.summary: Washington Post and other outlets tally decades of contracts, loans, subsidies and tax credits benefiting Musk companies.

events.title: Challenger: 280,253 layoff plans tied to DOGE actions (federal & contractors) in first two months
events.summary: Outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas attributes over 280k planned cuts to DOGE-related actions across 27 agencies.

events.title: Commerce Sec. Lutnick’s on-air remarks trigger ethics complaints
events.summary: Members of Congress and watchdogs requested OGE/Commerce IG review of televised remarks amid pending divestiture/recusal commitments.

sources.title: Sen. Reed letter to Commerce IG & OGE (PDF)
Campaign Legal Center complaint

events.title: EPA delays portions of TCE rule; signals ethylene oxide rollbacks/exemptions
events.summary: Post-regulatory-freeze updates delayed parts of the TCE ban and indicated changing approach to EtO sterilizer rules and selected exemptions.

sources.title: EPA – Status update on TSCA TCE rule
ProPublica – Republicans move to block TCE ban; delays

events.title: DOT announces enforcement grace period for new emissions standards
events.summary: DOT issued an enforcement policy providing a grace period for new emissions standards until Aug. 1, 2025.

events.title: Report: 34,000 Ohio ballots rejected in 2024 election after ID/process changes
events.summary: All Voting Is Local’s analysis finds significantly increased ballot rejections following Ohio HB 458 changes.

events.title: SpaceX awarded ~$5.9B share of Space Force NSSL Phase 3 contracts
events.summary: Space Force awards Lane 2 launch contracts totaling ~$13.5B to SpaceX (~$5.9B), ULA (~$5.4B), and Blue Origin (~$2.4B).

sources.title: Reuters – SpaceX/ULA/Blue Origin clinch NSSL awards
Air & Space Forces – Contract breakdowns

events.title: SpaceX wins ~$5.9B share of $13.5B Space Force launch contracts
events.summary: Space Force awards NSSL Phase 3 contracts to SpaceX (~$5.9B), ULA (~$5.4B), and Blue Origin (~$2.4B) through 2029.

events.title: Judge orders White House to restore AP access to presidential events
events.summary: A federal district court ordered the White House to restore Associated Press access after viewpoint-based exclusion.

events.title: Judge orders restoration of AP access to White House events
events.summary: A federal judge ordered the White House to restore AP’s access to cover presidential events, finding viewpoint-based exclusion violated the First Amendment.

events.title: USCIS to screen immigrants' social media for antisemitic activity
events.summary: USCIS announced that social media content would be considered in immigration benefit adjudications, drawing civil liberties concerns.

events.title: White House restructures press pool, removes permanent wire position
events.summary: Days after a court ordered the White House to restore AP access, the administration restructured the press pool and removed the permanent wire-service slot, drawing objections from WHCA and press-freedom groups.

events.title: Press Freedom Tracker: White House wrests control of press pool structure
events.summary: U.S. Press Freedom Tracker documents the White House removing the permanent wire position and restructuring the pool after the AP access ruling.

events.title: Judge allows unions’ APA challenge to DOGE data access to proceed
events.summary: Court declines to dismiss suit alleging DOGE access to PII at DOL, CFPB, HHS violated the Administrative Procedure Act.

events.title: Senate PSI minority memo estimates $2.37B in potential liabilities for Musk companies
events.summary: Memo tallies 65 actual or potential regulatory actions across 11 agencies; quantifies 40, including Tesla Autopilot cases and Neuralink.

events.title: Partnership for Public Service estimates DOGE costs could reach ~$135B in FY2025
events.summary: PPP analysis cited by major outlets estimates taxpayer costs from paid leave, productivity loss, and rehiring tied to DOGE actions.

events.title: Cochise County supervisor Thomas Crosby continues legal fight over 2022 certification
events.summary: Supervisor Thomas Crosby kept contesting charges tied to Cochise County’s 2022 certification delay, leaving a key test case over local officials’ duties pending into 2025.
events.notes: If this link changes, substitute with AP or Arizona Republic coverage of Crosby proceedings from May 2025.

events.title: TIGTA snapshot: IRS workforce reductions, DRP details
events.summary: Treasury Inspector General documents deferred resignation program terms and early reduction-in-force actions at IRS.

events.title: CRS Legal Sidebar: Geofence warrants and the Fourth Amendment
events.summary: Congressional Research Service details legal issues and split decisions around geofence warrants.

events.title: Reports of F‑1 student visa revocations linked to campus protest activity
events.summary: Universities reported F‑1 visa revocations for international students involved in campus protests; FOIA records and press reports detailed DHS/State coordination and SEVP guidance tightening compliance reviews.

sources.title: CNN: DHS revoking student visas linked to protests
Harvard Gazette: SEVP guidance and campus compliance
FOIA Docs: SEVP policy emails (excerpt repository)

events.title: GAO finds EV charging funds freeze violated Impoundment Control Act
events.summary: GAO’s legal opinion B‑337137 concluded the administration violated the ICA by withholding congressionally appropriated NEVI funds. OMB/DOT did not cure the violation.

sources.title: B-337137: Department of Transportation—Impoundment Control Act—NEVI Funds
White House tells DOT to disregard GAO opinion
House bill moves to cut GAO budget nearly in half

events.title: GAO finds unlawful withholding of EV charger funds (NEVI)
events.summary: GAO concluded that DOT’s actions on NEVI funds violated the Impoundment Control Act, finding funds were unlawfully withheld.

events.title: Reports of student visa revocations linked to campus protests
events.summary: Universities and press reported instances of student visa revocations tied to protest activity, raising free-speech concerns and prompting calls for transparency.

events.title: Memo authorizes DoD support to DHS; National Guard federalized; Marines deploy to Los Angeles
events.summary: A presidential memorandum authorized at least 2,000 Guard for 60 days to support DHS. Within days, federalized Guard and ~700 Marines supported operations in Los Angeles amid protests, triggering legal challenges.

events.title: Approximately 700 Marines deploy to Los Angeles
events.summary: Reports indicated about 700 Marines from 2/7 deployed in support of federal operations in Los Angeles; NORTHCOM issued a related statement.

events.title: Judge Denise Cote issues preliminary injunction restricting DOGE access to OPM records
events.summary: Court finds privacy and cybersecurity laws violated in granting DOGE affiliates access to OPM systems; limits further access pending litigation.

events.title: CPJ: Law enforcement injure multiple journalists covering Los Angeles protests
events.summary: Committee to Protect Journalists documents injuries and assaults of reporters covering immigration protest operations in Los Angeles.

events.title: DOJ issues updated guidelines for FCPA investigations and enforcement
events.summary: Justice Department released guidelines signaling the end of the blanket enforcement pause and prioritization of U.S. interests.

events.title: USNI: Marines deploy to downtown Los Angeles
events.summary: USNI News reported roughly 700 Marines from 2/7 deploying to downtown Los Angeles in support of federalized National Guard operations amid immigration-related protests.
events.notes: Cite specific article URL when archived link is available.

events.title: Georgia Supreme Court blocks State Election Board’s hand-count rule
events.summary: Georgia’s high court unanimously held the State Election Board exceeded its authority in adopting rules including a requirement to hand-count ballots at polling places, upholding a lower court’s block.

events.title: AP: Reporters shot with rubber bullets, roughed up covering LA protests
events.summary: Associated Press describes journalists being struck with projectiles or obstructed by police during coverage of Los Angeles protests.

events.title: Judge Breyer finds LA deployment unlawful; Ninth Circuit stays preserve status quo
events.summary: A federal district court held the deployments likely unlawful under statutory and federalism limits, but the Ninth Circuit granted emergency stays pending appeal, allowing deployments to continue.

sources.title: District court ruling reported; Ninth Circuit stay follows
Courthouse News on emergency stay

events.title: Federal judge says Los Angeles Guard/Marine deployment likely unlawful
events.summary: A federal district judge in California found the federalization of the state National Guard and deployment of active-duty Marines in Los Angeles likely unlawful, citing federalism concerns; the ruling was quickly stayed on appeal.

events.title: Starlink global outage caused by configuration change
events.summary: Starlink suffered a global outage attributed to a configuration change, disrupting connectivity for users worldwide.

events.title: Minnesota lawmaker Melissa Hortman assassinated; prosecutors cite political motive
events.summary: Rep. Melissa Hortman was shot and killed at her home; prosecutors called it a political assassination. A suspect was later indicted. Incident intensified concerns about politically motivated violence.

sources.title: AP: Minnesota lawmaker lies in state; suspect indicted
CNN live updates (June 15)
Wikipedia summary (for aggregation only)

events.title: State Department announces expanded screening and vetting for visa applicants
events.summary: State said it would expand visa screening, including review of online presence of applicants, as part of broader vetting changes.

events.title: Ninth Circuit stays district court order on LA deployment
events.summary: The Ninth Circuit stayed a district court order that found the Los Angeles deployment likely unlawful, preserving the deployment pending appeal.

events.title: Ninth Circuit extends stay keeping LA Guard/Marine deployment in place
events.summary: After a district court found the deployment likely unlawful, a Ninth Circuit panel extended the administrative stay, allowing the deployment to continue during appeal.
actors: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit

events.title: DHS issues National Terrorism Advisory System bulletin
events.summary: NTAS bulletin outlines elevated threat posture tied to geopolitical conflict and domestic mobilization risks.

events.title: Brookings warns on legal limits of putting soldiers on Los Angeles streets
events.summary: Brookings legal scholars analyzed the administration’s June 7 memorandum authorizing military support to DHS protests, warning it pushes the bounds of the Insurrection Act and risks normalizing domestic troop use.

events.title: House bill proposes nearly 50% cut to GAO; Senate rejects
events.summary: House appropriators advanced a Legislative Branch bill reducing GAO’s budget by roughly half and limiting its impoundment enforcement; Senate appropriators later rejected the cuts.

events.title: U.S. Election Assistance Commission releases 2024 EAVS report
events.summary: The EAC published its biennial Election Administration and Voting Survey, providing nationwide data on registration, voting methods, and election administration from 2024.

events.title: Brennan Center survey: local election officials warn of federal support cuts
events.summary: A national survey found growing concerns about federal cuts to election security services and ongoing resource stress.

events.title: Federal court restrains LAPD from using projectiles on journalists covering protests
events.summary: Following dozens of reported injuries and detentions of credentialed journalists during LA protests, a judge granted a TRO barring LAPD from firing ‘less‑lethal’ munitions at reporters.

sources.title: LA Times: Judge orders LAPD to stop shooting journalists with rubber bullets
CPJ: Law enforcement injure multiple journalists in LA
RCFP coalition letter documenting incidents
sources.outlet: Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press

events.title: Federal court restrains LAPD use of less-lethal force against journalists
events.summary: A federal judge issued a TRO prohibiting LAPD from using less-lethal munitions and chemical agents against clearly identified journalists covering protests, and from removing them from protest areas.

events.title: NCSL: 29 states prohibit or restrict private funding for election administration
events.summary: State policy tracker shows widespread adoption of bans on private grants to election offices.

events.title: DoD announces $200M-ceiling AI contracts to Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, xAI
events.summary: DoD CDAO unveils multi-vendor awards (each with $200M ceiling) for “frontier AI” capabilities; xAI included among awardees.

sources.title: DoD CDAO press – Partnerships with frontier AI companies
Reuters – Pentagon awards vendor list

events.title: DoD CDAO announces $200M-ceiling AI awards including xAI
events.summary: Defense Department announces partnerships with Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, and xAI—each with a $200M ceiling—to develop frontier AI capabilities.

events.title: GSA enters $1B OneGov cloud agreement with AWS
events.summary: GSA announced a $1 billion 'OneGov' cloud agreement with AWS intended to streamline federal procurement, raising questions about vendor concentration risk.

events.title: Cornyn urges FBI to locate Texas House Democrats amid redistricting standoff
events.summary: During a mid‑decade redistricting fight, Sen. John Cornyn asked FBI Director Kash Patel to help locate Texas Democratic legislators who left the state; the episode highlighted federal involvement in a state political dispute.

sources.title: Texas Tribune: Cornyn asks FBI to help find Democrats amid redistricting standoff

events.title: TIGTA update: IRS reductions and DRP effects as of July
events.summary: Follow-on TIGTA snapshot quantifies DRP and VERA/VSIP participation and implications for IRS operations and revenue.

events.title: Columbia University announces settlement with federal government
events.summary: Columbia agrees to pay $200M over three years to the federal government and $21M to resolve EEOC claims; settlement includes policy and oversight requirements.

events.title: FCC approves Skydance–Paramount merger 2–1; deal closes Aug. 7
events.summary: The FCC approved Skydance’s purchase of Paramount in a 2–1 vote; the merger closed Aug. 7. Coverage noted unusual conditions and concerns about editorial independence.

sources.title: FCC news release on approval
Reuters: US clears way for $8.4B Paramount–Skydance merger
AP: Merger closes, scrutiny on CBS News operations

events.title: Starlink global outage disrupts connectivity worldwide
events.summary: Multiple outlets report a global Starlink outage attributed to a network change, impacting users worldwide.

events.title: Senate PSI report alleges $21.7B in DOGE-created waste
events.summary: Minority staff report cites $14.8B in 'Deferred Resignation Program' payments and $6.1B in administrative leave among other waste categories.

events.title: TRAC: ICE arrests drop to ~990 per day in July 2025
events.summary: According to TRAC’s analysis of ICE data, average daily arrests fell to ~990 in July 2025 from 1,224 in June—a ~19% decline, amid litigation and public scrutiny of enforcement tactics.

events.title: Washington Post tests Meta’s replacement for political fact-checking
events.summary: WaPo reports 'coverage and speed gaps' in Meta’s Community Notes–style system for political content after Meta ended U.S. political fact-checking.

events.title: Federal judge strikes down California’s election deepfake law
events.summary: A federal judge in Sacramento struck down California’s law restricting AI‑generated political deepfakes; a related labeling requirement was also signaled as unconstitutional.

sources.title: Politico: Elon Musk and X notch court win
Bloomberg Law: Musk‑challenged deepfake law struck
Courthouse News: Judge rebukes California laws targeting misinformation

events.title: GAO says NIH grant delays violated the Impoundment Control Act
events.summary: GAO found that HHS/NIH unlawfully delayed grant funding in violation of the Impoundment Control Act.

events.title: Federal court blocks California’s political deepfake labeling/removal law
events.summary: Court enjoined key provisions requiring labels and removal of deceptive AI political content, siding with platforms on First Amendment grounds.

events.title: AP: Harvard scientists warn multi-billion research freeze could cause lasting damage
events.summary: AP reports researchers fear long-term setbacks following a $2.6B+ funding freeze amid federal-university dispute.

events.title: Skydance-Paramount deal closes; Reuters notes editorial 'ombudsman' undertakings
events.summary: Skydance’s acquisition of Paramount Global closed. Reuters reported the companies agreed to public-interest undertakings including newsroom ombuds positions and pledges on unbiased journalism.
events.notes: While Reuters reported FCC-related undertakings tied to broadcast license transfers, final conditions are still being parsed across agencies; cite Reuters for contemporaneous reporting.

events.title: White House orders federal surge in D.C.; FBI agents patrol streets; Guard activation prepared
events.summary: The White House announced an increased federal law‑enforcement presence in Washington, D.C. Reports indicated ~120 FBI agents on street patrols and preparations to activate hundreds of D.C. National Guard members.

sources.title: AP: Increased federal presence ordered
Washington Post: FBI agents dispatched to D.C. streets
Reuters: Military preparing Guard activation in D.C.

events.title: White House announces increased federal law-enforcement presence in Washington, D.C.
events.summary: Administration outlines expanded patrols by federal agents at tourist sites and transit hubs.

events.title: Administration seeks $1B settlement from UCLA amid $584M funding freeze
events.summary: Federal officials propose a $1B agreement tied to policy terms; California leaders denounce demand as extortion.

events.title: About 120 FBI agents assigned to patrol Washington, D.C. streets
events.summary: Washington Post reports reassignment of approximately 120 FBI agents to street patrol duties as part of DC surge.

events.title: Military preparing to activate hundreds of D.C. National Guard members
events.summary: Reuters reports preparations to activate the DC National Guard to support increased federal presence.
